spans.text: Mom and Dad said you rarely come home.
Ah... after all, I'm very busy with work.
(At least I go home to see them during the holidays...)
...Isn't my sister the same?
I'm that's...
I understand, my sister's work requires frequent business trips.
I will go home for the Chinese New Year this year.
...Definitely.
(At that time... I will be gone.)
I know you are working hard, but Mom and Dad will miss you.
I know...
(...When I was little, they weren't home much either.)
Maki put down her water glass, and Taki saw that the coffee liquid inside was almost gone.
Speaking of which, it's hard to imagine your personality becoming a teacher.
...After all, the working hours are flexible, and I can also play the drums.
It sounds like the band is your main business.
...You could say that.
(After all, teaching children to play drums was originally a part-time job.)
(But MyGO!!!!! won't debut, can this be called a main business?)
MyGO hasn't had a live in a long time, right?
Everyone... has a full-time job.
And your full-time job is MyGO's drummer and composer.
Taki, do you... only compose for MyGO?
Yes……
We made a promise to be in a band for life.
This doesn't mean you can only compose for MyGO for the rest of your life.
If your job is a drummer or composer, then MyGO is just a title, Taki.
I don't think I've heard MyGO release a new song in a long time.
(It's meaningless to discuss these things now, right...)
Sister... are you following MyGO's activities?
Yes.
Then... what do you think...?
(What about my songs...)
Uh, I've always liked the lyrics...
...The lyrics are like poetry.
Your lyricist is the lead singer, right?
Yes.
She looks very dazzling when she tries her best on stage.
Hoo...
(After all, it's Tomori.)
I don't listen to much rock music, but...
The song has your style.
The rhythm section has a strong presence, especially your drums.
There's nothing special about it...
(Only my work is still related to musical instruments. I can't ask them to maintain the same practice time as me. To achieve the desired effect, I can only start with the drums.)
(But to make my sister feel that the drum beats are prominent... but if I weaken the drum beats, where can I make up for the effect...)
(Should I add more changes to the guitar and bass?)
I remember people praising your skills when you were in junior high school.
After leaving the brass band, you also put all your effort into the drum set.
I just……
(At that time, I was just escaping my sister's light...)
At least you like playing the drums more than the trumpet.
Th-that's... !
Okay, I'm not blaming you.
...Crychic, right? The band at that time.
It has stopped its activities.
Ah……
(It's been a long time since I heard this name.)
But MyGO...
Will be in a band for life, I know.
(...What am I fighting for?)
(After I die, MyGO will also stop its activities, right?)
I, I'll go get some water for my sister.
A band for life... To be able to regard such a naive promise as an oath, I'm a little envious.
Taki absentmindedly wiped the remaining water on the cup, repeatedly chewing on her sister's words.
"And your full-time job is MyGO's drummer and composer."
"This doesn't mean you can only compose for MyGO for the rest of your life."
"The song has your style."
Crychic
, right? The band at that time. It has stopped its activities."
Taki composes day and night in the time outside of teaching and practicing drums, but MyGO!!!!! hasn't released a new song in a long time.

Taki remembered that long-lost former teammate, whose name was all over various types of songs, and who had already enjoyed secular success. The great artist in people's eyes can smoothly change styles and easily abandon their own expression.
The panda water glass and the table knocked together, making a crisp sound, and Taki came back to her senses.
What's the point of thinking about this now...
(In any case, this is the last song.)
(A band for life... I shouldn't be breaking my promise, right?)
Her stomach made a sound at the wrong time, and Taki felt the emptiness in her stomach.
Taki rummaged through the refrigerator for a nutritional jelly, and swallowed most of it as soon as she opened the package.
After slightly relieving her hunger, she realized that she hadn't cared about her sister yet, after all, it wasn't meal time when she called.
(I should have asked my sister first...)
Sister, is there anything you want to eat?
Let me see...
Maki looked at the empty refrigerator and then at the empty nutritional jelly packaging bag in Taki's hand.
I, I mean, we can eat out too...
(The izakayas nearby should be opening soon at this time, right?)
As soon as she finished speaking, a lightning strike not far away startled the two of them, followed by a downpour.
You probably didn't have lunch, did you?
If my sister hasn't eaten either, we can wait for the rain to stop...
If I'm not here, is eating this enough for you?
...Nutritional jelly has a very strong feeling of fullness.
Taki's heartbeat was as accurate as a metronome, and under this stable rhythm, she really didn't need to take in more.
The rain showed no signs of stopping, and they couldn't go out for a while.
Taki thought for a while, then took out a new bag of nutritional jelly and handed it to Maki.
That's what you're so good at...
What?
You can maintain focus for a long time despite having terrible living habits.
Not really...
(I just like to find inspiration in the middle of the night... In fact, the efficiency is very low after staying up all night.)
Alas... is this also a kind of talent...?
What kind of talent is this...
(After all, I don't have the ability to do everything with ease like my sister, so I can only make up for it with hard work.)
The wind and rain began to knock on the windows, and the sisters looked out the window with different thoughts.
The dark clouds had already swallowed the last bit of light on the horizon, and it was impossible to tell day and night by the color of the sky. This weather was really not suitable for going out.
Maki took out two cans of beer from the refrigerator.
Are you still working today?
Ah, maybe...
I heard that for some creators, alcohol can catalyze inspiration.
Taki recalled the night she went to the izakaya with Umiri.
(Facts have proved that I am definitely not that kind of person.)
What's wrong?
...Nothing.
Okay.
You, even if it's a talent, you can't be too harsh on yourself.
Eat on time in the future... at least eat lunch, the proper kind, got it?
I know.
...My sister did well in both club activities and academics in high school.
(And I even skipped classes to compose, what talent...)
Are you trying to say that I can't even take care of myself?
No, no,
I mean, it's considered a talent to be able to complete a plan without having to do this...
Silly girl.
Sister?
Effort is the most rare talent.
(How is that possible.)
(Anyone can work hard, but not everyone can get results.)
(Being able to work hard in the orchestra that my sister manages is already a one-in-a-hundred genius.)
Although I don't have the perseverance to stay up all night with just nutritional jelly, I sometimes don't sleep earlier than you, Taki.
Have you forgotten who taught you how to put on makeup?

Taki silently pried open the pull tab, not getting much comfort from her sister's words. The person sitting across from her was a social elite. Even if she also needed to stay up late to complete her work, they were completely different. From ten years ago, or even earlier, their gap had already become a chasm.
(I can only see your back.)
(My sister won't understand, will she?)
(Now it seems that I really... can no longer catch up with you.)
The filling bubbles burst in her mouth, and the slight bitterness of the beer was enhanced by her mood. Taki felt that she couldn't drink too much today.
Taki, from the beginning, you never took your hard work seriously.
Although I don't have the right to say you, but...
Don't consume your youth capital too much.
...I'll pay attention.
Sister is always on business trips, so you should also pay attention to rest.
(My sister's work is actually more difficult, right? Don't be like me...)
Taki...?
What's wrong, sister?
You're very strange today. You don't usually say such things.
And you wouldn't agree so quickly.
Th-this is...
...Maybe the friends in the band have had a big influence on me.
Really?
...Yes.
For a time, there was only silence in the restaurant again.
The new song has been stuck for a long time, right?
Have you been preparing for this song during the time MyGO hasn't released a song?
Huh?
No, actually, writing this song was just an idea these past few days.
I thought you would always be preparing new songs during the days when you didn't release songs.
Uh, we actually have been practicing, but the time doesn't quite match up...
So we didn't have time to record the song...
Taki, do you really not have the idea of becoming a professional composer?
I just think you don't have to lock your talent in a band that is just a hobby.
As long as you want, you can become an excellent composer.
Sister?
You've been mentioning this since just now...
I really like MyGO's songs.
I just suddenly remembered that your composer friend doesn't seem to only write songs for her own band.
I'm different from her.
Of course, I'm just an amateur.
Is my sister towards MyGO...
I said, I like MyGO's songs.
Also... a band formed in high school that has been maintained for seven years through friendship is really amazing.
Cherish your friends.
(Is she reminiscing about her time in the brass band?)
Maki silently stared at the jumping bubbles, and Taki felt her unspoken melancholy.
Taki realized that she didn't understand her sister at all.
...Cheers.
Pfft...
Wh-what's wrong?
Nothing.
The two cans clinked together, and Taki breathed a sigh of relief when she saw her sister's smile.
(If my sister had continued to study music, maybe she would have been a member of a famous orchestra by now?)
(My sister can succeed no matter what she does.)
If my sister continued to play the trumpet in the symphony orchestra, her achievements would not be inferior to what she is now.
Maybe.
Being a musician is not an easy thing.
Did Taki choose the path of music for MyGO?
Huh?
I have never thought so.
……That's good.
I've always been worried that you were forcing yourself.
I didn't.
(There just always has to be someone pushing the band forward.)
Yes.
I'm glad you can choose a career you like.
Maki raised her can and touched Taki's can on the table, then raised her head and drank the last sip.
Having learned Maki's thoughts, Taki was finally relieved - her sister didn't dislike MyGO!!!!!.
The minuscule amount of alcohol played its role under the influence of reassurance, and a warm current surged in the metronome-like heartbeat. Taki actually relaxed and felt sleepy.
Are you sleepy?
No.
You were planning to continue working later, right?
Uh……
It looks like the rain won't stop tonight.
I have to borrow an umbrella from you.
Huh? Is my sister leaving?
I won't disturb your work, but remember to rest early - at least earlier than you originally planned.
But it's thundering outside, and the neighborhood isn't safe at this time...
And my sister just arrived in Japan today, and hasn't cleaned up the house yet, right?
Then what's your solution?
I have a guest room in my house...
Has your guest room been cleaned up?
Well, I'll tell Mom and Dad, I'll trouble you tonight.
Yeah, I got it.
